titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Arthur Bridgman Clark Papers
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives
publicationstmt.p: Copyright © 2015 The Board of Trustees of the Leland Stanford Junior University. All rights reserved.

note.p: This encoded finding aid is compliant with Stanford EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Collection includes genealogical material relating to the family of Professor Arthur B. Clark; "Drawings and notes of a motor trip" through Europe, Spain and Morocco in 1931-32 by Arthur B. Clark and Grace Clark (printed volumes, letters, original drawings, and prints); financial records, 1906-1921, and miscellaneous papers, 1864-1904; and original woodblocks, prints and copper plates by Professor Clark.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Arthur Bridgman Clark Papers (SC0275). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Head of the Department of Art, Professor Clark taught at Stanford from 1893 until his retirement in 1931. He specialized in the printing method.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Collection includes genealogical material relating to the family of Professor Arthur B. Clark; "Drawings and notes of a motor trip" through Europe, Spain and Morocco in 1931-32 by Arthur B. Clark and Grace Clark (printed volumes, letters, original drawings, and prints); financial records, 1906-1921, and miscellaneous papers, 1864-1904; and original woodblocks, prints and copper plates by Professor Clark.

did.unittitle: 1 folder of miscellaneous sheets and correspondence related to the Genealogy.
Stanford Illustrated Review issue containing an article on Clark becoming Professor Emeritus.
“Drawings and Notes of a Motor Trip” (unbound pamphlets), Vol. I (3 copies), Vol. II (3 copies), Vol. III (2 copies), Vol. IV (1 Copy).
Negatives of photos for the Genealogy, etc.
Manuscript letters and drawings of the 1931-32 trip through Europe.
Original printing plates (woodblocks and etched plates).
Original printing plates (woodblocks and etched plates).
